meanings.definition: A collection of written texts or documents.
meanings.sent1: The library contains various corpora of ancient manuscripts.
meanings.sent2: Researchers analyzed a large corpora of data to draw conclusions.
meanings.sent3: The detective sifted through the corpora of evidence to solve the case.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a vast corpora of knowledge, ready to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The corpora of research papers provided valuable insights into the topic.

meanings.definition: The main body or mass of a structure.
meanings.sent1: The corpora of the building was made of sturdy bricks.
meanings.sent2: The corpora of the tree trunk supported many branches.
meanings.sent3: The corpora of the cake was the delicious chocolate layer.
meanings.sent4: The corpora of the organization was its dedicated employees.
meanings.sent5: The corpora of the mountain was visible from afar, towering over the landscape.

meanings.definition: The body of a person or animal.
meanings.sent1: The corpora of the athlete was well-toned and strong.
meanings.sent2: The corpora of the cat gracefully moved through the room.
meanings.sent3: The corpora of the teddy bear was soft and cuddly.
meanings.sent4: The corpora of the elephant was massive and impressive.
meanings.sent5: The corpora of the dancer moved with grace and precision.
